comment.value: A Personal Medkit contains what you need to stop bleeding, disinfect a wound and cauterize it, some Pharmax bandages to wrap it up and a stim boost to keep you on your feet. A Medkit is not a permanent solution, it's more of a band aid to keep your guts from spilling out until you reach an Auto-Doc. Gives a +2 modification to Medical Aid rolls but can only be used once.
comment.label: Text

special.value:
STRENGTH 10, AGILITY 2, WITS 5, EMPATHY 3
SKILLS: Heavy Machinery 2, Comtech 2, Observation 2, Mobility 1
TALENT: Full Throttle
GEAR: Built-in cutting torch (Power Supply 6) and self-reloading bolt gun, two hydraulic grip-vices.

A NOTE FROM MU/TH/UR: These machines take half damage (rounding up) from fire and are immune to radiation and EMP effects. If they are attacked, or someone attempts to deactivate them, they will defend themselves—roll on the same table but +3 to the automaton attack roll.

THE AUTOMATONS
Pelican Colony is entirely automated, the farms, factories and utilities all running themselves. Other activities are carried out by the automatons, little more than automated Powerloaders. Their programming is simple—fulfill basic tasks and protect life. They will also protect themselves against being deactivated, as they must be active to succeed in their primary tasks. To deactivate an automaton a PC needs to access the control panel on its back, using MOBILITY to climb up the hand and footholds built into the machine for that purpose, and make a COMTECH roll. The automatons will use force to protect the PCs, from the radiation or other threats as the robots see it, using the automaton attack table.
special.label: Text

Their programming is simple—fulfill basic tasks and protect life. They will also protect themselves against being deactivated, as they must be active to succeed in their primary tasks. To deactivate an automaton a PC needs to access the control panel on its back, using MOBILITY to climb up the hand and footholds built into the machine for that purpose, and make a COMTECH roll. The automatons will use force to protect the PCs, from the radiation or other threats as the robots see it, using the automaton attack table.

appearance.value:
UPP COSMOS EXPLORATION CORPS

Courageous, pragmatic, and reasonable, Sensakovic commands one of the four UPP scout ships that secretly came to the Far Spinward Colonies before the Great Mother Mission. She is learning something about the horrors in this sector of space.
appearance.label: appearance

agenda.value:
She supports the UPP's desire to ensure the Great Mother Mission is a success for the people of the UPP but has misgivings about the military approach. She has seen the Perfected firsthand and knows the threat they present. She has come to stop the Perfected using the Lychgate to reach the Middle Heavens. If the PCs convince her they have a common goal she is pragmatic enough to join forces.

If the PCs save her and help her escape the Lychgate, she will be an ally in trying to convince General Ozolinski to stop the coup and fight the Perfected, although she knows she has been facehugged
agenda.label: agenda

system.notes:
LIEUTENANT COLONEL SONIA SENSAKOVIC

UPP COSMOS EXPLORATION CORPS

Courageous, pragmatic, and reasonable, Sensakovic commands one of the four UPP scout ships that secretly came to the Far Spinward Colonies before the Great Mother Mission. She is learning something about the horrors in this sector of space. She supports the UPP's desire to ensure the Great Mother Mission is a success for the people of the UPP but has misgivings about the military approach. She has seen the Perfected firsthand and knows the threat they present. She has come to stop the Perfected using the Lychgate to reach the Middle Heavens. If the PCs convince her they have a common goal she is pragmatic enough to join forces.

If the PCs save her and help her escape the Lychgate, she will be an ally in trying to convince General Ozolinski to stop the coup and fight the Perfected, although she knows she has been facehugged.

NOTE: Sensakovic's Chestburster will erupt at a moment best suited to raise the tension. However, if the PCs are especially kind to her and win her trust, she will tell them she is doomed. The PCs can then choose to help save her, by getting her to Ìyánlá's medical center.

comment.value: You are used to taking a beating. You increase your health by +2, i.e. your maximum number is equal to your Strength plus 2.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: Between fights, you release the tension in your team with some friendly banter. Your Stress Level, and the Stress Level of everyone in Short Range of you, drops two steps (instead of one) for every Turn spent in a safe place. Having several Marines with this talent doesn't increase the effect.
comment.label: Text

comment.value:
Built-in comm unit.
Standard issue for the UPP, the 6B90 consists of a rigid armor padded vest, a flexible ballistic pad that covers the abdomen, and clamshell greaves on the lower legs. The armor protects against edged weapons and glancing blows from high powered ammunition. It has a built-in comm unit and Personal Data Transmitter, combat webbing straps to connect a variety of equipment, and contact points which monitor the wearer's vitals and transmit them to a tactical monitoring station. Armor rating 6.
comment.label: Text

comment.value:
Full auto.

The UPP equivalent to the M41A Pulse Rifle, the AK-4047 is a cheap and reliable substitute.
As such, the weapon often winds up in the hands of mercenaries and insurgents.
While not as accurate as the M41A, the AK-4047 is sturdier than the USCMC weapon.
An AK-4047 still works after being thrown off a cliff and left underwater for a month.
comment.label: Text

comment.value:
ARMOR PIERCING.

The most recent of the Grach series, the 4043 has overcome some of the earlier design flaws that made this the most beautiful but most under-performing pistol in the SOF armory.  The 4043 is the pinnacle of UPP small arms design, carried by senior officers who are forced to earn the right to use one.
comment.label: Text

climate.value: Breathable with occasional salt-filled stinging winds
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Salt flats and pillars surrounding massive saltwater lakes
terrain.label: Terrain

keyResources.value: Magnesium, lithium, halite, oxygen, and aquaculture
keyResources.label: Key Resources

comment.value: In the latter half of the 21st century, this system housed a major European military base in the Far Spinward Colonies.  When the 3WE was formed in 2088, May Outpost became home to a full Commando of royal marines.  After the Weyland Corporation collapse, many of the marines and colonists returned to the core systems, leaving only a reserve contingent here with their families.

terrain.value: Honeycombed caverns throughout craggy mountains and high plateaus
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value:
Spearheaded by cosmologist and philanthropist Eldridge Dylan Sanchez, the establishment of the system KOI-784 was a long and arduous task.  A systemic failure of the atmospheric processor plant on Dylan City brought a pause to the initial terraforming effort, which was eventually restarted eight years later in 2062.

While an independent science team determined the trouble to be the result of indigenous subterranean single-cell life forms, the company chose to ignore their recommendation to stop colonization.  The process was finally completed by 2069.  A precious metal mining colony, alternately called Dylan City, Dylan Colony, or just Dylan, this world was a thriving center for the Far Spinward Colonies.

climate.value: Hazy but breathable atmosphere with massive dust storms
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Low flatlands with deep black seas
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value: Ute Colony in the KOI-1430 system was the first to introduce Kelland Mining Company's advanced extrasolar mining technologies and techniques to their mining operations.  Within a month of installation, they had increased their production by 130%.  Ute also processed hydrogen cells from the planet's black seas, making the colony essential to the sector's energy needs.

climate.value: Still air followed by silicate hurricanes
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Dry sandstone expanses pockmarked with quarries and subterranean lakes
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value:
Several millions of years ago, KOI-2770.01 collided with an asteroid enriched with large quantities of palladium.  The impact created massive deposits of the mineral which were targeted for exploitation by Weyland Corp.

Instead of simple mining, Izvinite Outpost also had the facilities to refine the precious metal.  Massive sub-surface electrolysis turbine plants are used to break down water molecules into its hydrogen and oxygen components for separate export to other worlds.

terrain.value: Ever-branching tributaries and river deltas crisscrossing plains and basins
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value:
Named after famous cosmologist and philanthropist Eldridge D. Sanchez, Sanchez Outpost's industry featured arrays of automated deep mining machines.  While it started as a small outpost, within a few years it had become a sprawling colony powered by a substantial dam system.  In addition to the Outpost, this system is known for the massive gas giants Ojo and Atomos and the many moons that surround them.

In 2105, the last message transmitted from the outpost was from Sanchez himself, proclaiming an in-system discovery that in his own words would, “change human life as we know it.” What that was remains a mystery to this day.

terrain.value: Glacial dry ice pockmarked with geothermal vents
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value:
Kareti Colony in the KOI-723 system is a prime example of early Weyland Corp pioneers' defiance in the face of a cold and unforgiving universe.  Primitive single-cell organisms were detected living near geothermal vents upon the sixth planet's discovery.  Unfortunately, the company probe incorrectly tagged the planet for colonization.  Instead of a simple scientific expedition, an entire colony mission led by J.V.  Gorham was sent to the world.

Upon arrival, it became clear that its inhospitable carbon-dioxide-rich atmosphere would not lend itself to terraforming.

The atmospheric plant threatened to overload when attempting to scrub the air and the colony's structures failed to keep the infiltrating toxic environment out.

In competition with Eldridge Sanchez over who could put down roots on the more hostile world, Gorham had the plant's processors shut down, vacuum-sealed the facility, and moved the research team in.  The rest of the colonists went on to settle on Sanchez Outpost (above).

climate.value: Breathable with vibrant bright skies and dusk-for-night.
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Rough, rocky planet
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value:
Settled by colonists from Capelli Colony, July Outpost was founded as a manufacturing center on the first planet of the KOI-1739 system.

It soon became the central manufacturing hub for atmosphere processors in the Far Spinward Colonies.  The outpost's industry was so successful they even exported processors back to the Outer Veil colonies.

terrain.value: Northern hemisphere is stratified rock.  Southern is dominated by vast algal biomass covered seas
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value:
When seen from orbit, KOI-2469.01 was noted for its southern seas' apparent autumn colors.  An outpost was established here in 2069 as a resupply base for further extrasolar expeditions.  When microorganisms were discovered to be the cause of the seas' strange pigmentation, the post was repurposed for scientific research.  A form of alien algae, the organisms were found to have many practical applications ranging from terraforming to a viable food source.

During the colonial food shortages of the latter half of the 21st century, October Outpost became a major food supplier, cultivating algae in floating farms and exporting foodstuffs to both the Outer Veil and the Far Spinward Colonies.

terrain.value: Buttes and valleys
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value: During a probe flyby of the KOI-1404 system, the planetoid labeled Archimedes was found to be rich in lithium and chromite deposits—materials necessary for extrasolar vehicle construction.  A surface-based spaceport and starship repair base was established here, making Archimedes a shipping hub between the Far Spinward Colonies and the Outer Veil.

terrain.value: Sprawling urban landscape with multiple atmospheric processor “mountains”
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value: Colonized by engineers, technicians, and environmental specialists, the Capelli Colony in the KOI-2290 system was the first manufacturer of next generation atmosphere processors.  When the planet was found to have an abundance of mineable metals and ores, the colony's population grew past the initial work crews to over a million souls.  Because of fusion reactor safety protocols, atmospheric processor production was moved off world to July Outpost (above).

terrain.value: Fertile farmlands
terrain.label: Terrain

colonies.value: One central hub with radiating farms spread far out from each other
colonies.label: Colonies

comment.value: While the planets in this system had no flora of their own when colonists arrived a century ago, the soil on KOI-947.01 was found to be exceptionally fertile.  With only a limited amount of terraforming, the colony cultivated a productive agricultural industry.  Pelican Colony became a major food provider in the second half of the 21st century.  When the Far Spinward Colonies were cut off, food prices in the Middle Heavens skyrocketed.  If any FSC worlds continued to thrive after the 20-parsec limit was established, it's likely they would get their foodstuffs from Pelican.

terrain.value: Deep soupy oceans with underwater geothermal vents
terrain.label: Terrain

colonies.value: One submersible outpost typically buoyed at the surface with five deep water colonies across the globe
colonies.label: Colonies

comment.value:
The primordial water world of KOI-2020.01 is a xenobiologist's dream.  The seafloor is home to pockets of bacterial life essential to medical research.  The colony's seabed operations are divided into industrial sectors for both mining and health.

January Outpost itself sits on the ocean surface—a structure called a Marine Made Mobile Island (M3I).  The M3I is the size of a Bison freighter and able to submerge to a depth of 2,000 meters.  Most research on this world is conducted through the use of EVA Pods ).

climate.value: Highlands with a thin but breathable atmosphere.  Increased heat and pressure within the kilometer-­deep chasms
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Rocky shale, deep chasms and crumbling cliff faces and peninsulas
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value:
Established in 2067 after nearly a decade of terraforming, this mining colony is named after industrialist and pioneer J.V.  Gorham.  The site of the deepest mining operations ever drilled, Gorham's mine shafts extend some 23 km deep.  At its height, Gorham's Colony reached a population of one million colonists.

By 2108, Gorham had plans to increase mining production by introducing a tunneling creature native to the Outer Rim world Tartarus—the Harvester.  It is unclear if the shipment of Harvesters ever made it to the colony before the FSC were cut off from the Middle Heavens.

Once major contributors to humankind's expansion, these worlds were abandoned when the 20-parsec limit was established in the 2110s.
While the colonies were ordered to evacuate, no one made it back after the recall. 
The information presented in this section details these settlements at the sector's height, circa 2071.  Even if your PCs never visit these planets, they offer a good example of older, more established colonies.  The current disposition of some of these worlds is covered in the Lost Worlds campaign.
What has happened to the rest is up to you.

THE ISOLATION
At the turn of the century, several star systems between the Middle Heavens and the Far Spinward Colonies went supernova, flooding the region with star remnants, intense gamma radiation, and violent neutrino bursts.  This interstellar haze has permeated the area for decades, making travel there impossible—several ships were lost in the attempt.  As of the 2180s, the interference has begun to dissipate enough to risk an expedition back to the FSC—the UNISC Great Mother Mission. 
The question remains, what will they find out there—a thriving interstellar civilization of joint colonies, or isolationist chaos and death?
comment.label: Text

commonName.value: PYLOS, ATOL SPHACTERIA FUEL DEPOT AND WAYSTATION
commonName.label: Text

climate.value: Planet atmosphere is toxic, station air is recycled through old scrubbers and tastes like tin
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Pressurized ammonia and methane gasses
terrain.label: Terrain

population.value: 48 workers and 40 UNISC troops on station
population.label: Population

comment.value:
Pylos is a gas giant situated in a forgotten and secluded part of space.  The United Nations Interstellar Settlement Corps set up space station ATOL Sphacteria orbiting Pylos here to act as a spinward Frontier fuel depot.  A Colonial Marshal's office and a platoon of UNISC troops are stationed on Sphacteria.  Along with its massive fuel pods, this depot has two internal drydocks and outer docking facilities for up to twelve class F to M starships.

The station is neutral, servicing all nations and ships alike.  The station's central tower maintains two extendable fuel grapplers that can capture a ship and pull it in for refueling.  A Lockmart towing shuttle is docked here to assist in starship repairs.

climate.value: Breathable atmosphere, overcast, intense thunderstorms and gale force winds
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Barren rock formations and muddy lowlands
terrain.label: Terrain

colonies.value: One settlement, quarantined (200 colonists, presumed dead)
colonies.label: Colonies

comment.value:
Located in the Beta Canum Venaticorum (Chara) system, LV-187 is a mineral and oil rich rocky planet.  While the system's sun is a main sequence star, the constant cloud cover makes day here akin to dusk on most worlds.  Its breathable atmosphere is constantly wracked with storms and high force winds.  Severe flooding and wind damage are the norm here.  The surface is covered with mud and runoff from the frequent storms.

The colony itself is two kilometers of interconnected corridors stretching east to west with a central hub in the middle.  The planet was recently the victim of a biological outbreak that may have been caused by the Border Bombers.  Forces of the ICSC, NAPRO, UPP, and 3WE blockaded the system in a stalemate, each waiting for the other to make the first aggressive move.

terrain.value: Forested valleys and rivers
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value: This mineral-rich system, dominated by the planet Traon, has been leased to the Kelland Mining Company to exploit for Omni-Tech.  Large automated mining facilities cover Traon, extending deep beneath the surface.  The machines are powered by geothermal taps.  A contingent of 300 miners and wildcatters maintains the digs and scouts for new mining sites.

climate.value: Thick but breathable, hot and humid
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Steamy jungle world with yellow vegetation
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value: Iota Persei is a main sequence star with a system of three worlds.  Only one is the correct distance from the star to support life—and support life it does.  Iota Persei III is a lush jungle world of amber alien plants similar to the foliage discovered by the USCMC on Fujima 514.  A dismissed survey report suggests massive archaeological ruins with equally massive stone heads jutting from the jungle floor lie hidden in the dense banana-yellow foliage.

terrain.value: Ragged rock formations and fissures
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value:
Featuring a flare-type star, Sz Ursae Majoris is a deadly system with a scorched barren super earth called Suzie 2—replete with mineral-rich moons and asteroids.  A flare star is a variable star that can undergo unpredictable dramatic increases in energy output for short intervals.  Analogous to solar flares, these outbursts eject magnetic energy stored in the stars' atmospheres, causing periodic loss of comms and power outages to ships, vehicles, and equipment in the system.

Any colony here would need specially hardened electronics. The system's most eligible moon for colonization is Selene, a deep blue hunk of azurite with a tenuous atmosphere ripe for taming via atmospheric processors.

Large veins of copper exist here as well. On the surface, the skies periodically flash as crystalline particles in the upper atmosphere react to the flaring star.

commonName.value:
GJ1187.03 “SHĀNMÉN”
SUEÑOS GRANDES, NEW LUHANSK, ROMASHKA OUTPOST, OTHER SETTLEMENTS
commonName.label: Text

terrain.value: Lush jungle to thick rainforests, fungi clumps, rocky mountains
terrain.label: Terrain

colonies.value: Five colonies and several small outposts, all destroyed. Planet quarantined. Population: Unknown, pre-bombing: 20,000+
colonies.label: Colonies

comment.value:
[QUARANTINE ALERT]

Targeted by the Border Bombers, the UPP and Jùtóu Combine mining world of Shānmén was a vital source of the rare mineral eitr. The lush planet once supported several colonies along with some minor research outposts. The local fauna included meter-long flying insects and large predatory cats. Megafauna ranged from sauropods to large flying hawk-like creatures—all of which have now been mutated into monstrosities by the black pathogen dispersed in the atmosphere.

While the Border Bomber craft responsible for attacking the colonies here was destroyed by the multi-national marine force called the Jackals, only survivors from two settlements were confirmed to have been recovered. The various governments involved are currently in UNISC sessions to discuss the viability of nuking the planet.

The 340-kilometer area of the former colony is a radiation dead zone, so caution is recommended. Nearing completion, the new colony is to be called Pype's Line for the many pumps and conduits used to siphon the crude oil deposits from deep under the irradiated zone safely to the colony kilometers away.

climate.value: Breathable. electric storms, dry with sporadic flash floods
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Red sand-deserts and jutting spires
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value: This binary system consists of a main sequence star (Theta Persei A) and its red dwarf companion (Theta Persei B). While this system has been noted for the possibility of earth-like planets in the star's habitable zones, only one has been cataloged—a dead rock with a red sand desert moon designated LV-139. High temperatures dominate the day with freezing temperatures at night. Blue lightning electric storms are common. Other than the moon, Theta Persei has strangely remained unexplored for nearly a century.

terrain.value: Wetlands with swamp gas
terrain.label: Terrain

colonies.value: Research station with several laboratory outposts
colonies.label: Colonies

comment.value:
Discovered in 2061 in a cooperative effort between industrialist William Tark and the Weyland Corp, the third planet here is home to numerous colonies of simple xeno-bacteria.  A permanent research facility was established here called Tark-Weyland Station.  The station's microbiological and biochemical engineers have put together a think tank to combat new forms of cancer that do not respond to established treatments.

Recently, Tark-Weyland's Molecular Science Group assigned a think tank to work on developing an antigen that would slow the advance of the black pathogen deployed in the Border Bombers' attacks.

Unfortunately, the project's lead scientists—Professor Hugo Cléas and Doctor Hide Tajima—went missing while attempting to obtain samples of the pathogen.  Their current status is unknown.

affiliation.value: 3WE research world leased to Bionational and Weyland-Yutani
affiliation.label: Affiliation

climate.value: Harmful aerosols and poisonous gasses.  Simple rebreathers required.
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Green seas and volcanic islands
terrain.label: Terrain

colonies.value:
One, abandoned.
Rotating scientific expeditions, typically 6–48 explorers and scientists at any time
colonies.label: Colonies

comment.value:
The POL-6362 system features a world named for Weyland Corp's Jacob-Tellis expedition.

This primordial world was settled in 2071, but its small colonial outpost was abandoned when Weyland Corp stocks fell in the 2090s.  Covered in volcanic ash, its structures still stand on an equatorial island chain.  The planet is home to numerous forms of aquatic xeno-microfauna.  Science teams from Tark-Weyland Station make several expeditions here every year, collecting and cataloging microscopic protozoa and arthropods.

commonName.value: GL537A “DELOS” (WEYLAND-YUTANI SPINWARD SHIPPING AND DISTRIBUTION CENTER)
commonName.label: Text

affiliation.value: Weyland-Yutani.  Trades with ICSC, UA, and 3WE.
affiliation.label: Affiliation

climate.value: Thin atmosphere (–1 to all STAMINA rolls without breathing equipment)
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Frost covered ice world with sporadic deep thermal springs and steam vents
terrain.label: Terrain

colonies.value: Shipping and distribution facilities on surface, several loading and fuel stations in orbit
colonies.label: Colonies

comment.value:
Supplies to the Weyland Isles Sector and other outer colonies are distributed through the barter station at Delos.  Here, freighters take on frontier-mined ores and other cargoes intended for the core systems.  They also bring supplies from the core to the Frontier.

Under normal circumstances, treaties allow civilian freighters to pass through UPP space to reach Delos.  The Frontier War disrupted those routes for nearly two years.  While trade routes have been re-established, Delos has been over-tasked with getting the colonies much needed food, fuel, and medicines.

A strategic asset, Delos is a prime target for an invasion by the New Albion Protectorate.

terrain.value: Over-industrialized wasteland crisscrossed with deep strip-mine gouges
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value: While already considered a protectorate of the UPP, this former mining colony was annexed by them during the Frontier War.  Kawlang is an over-industrialized moon covered in factories and fog.  Factories here produce the weapons and machines of the UPPA war machine.

terrain.value: Pockmarked and cratered metamorphic rock with two-kilometer-deep mine shafts
terrain.label: Terrain

colonies.value: One, Mining Site B (2,000 miners, 250 support staff)
colonies.label: Colonies

comment.value:
This somewhat barren system has a large main sequence variable star orbited by a cold debris disk rich in rare earth metals.  The largest piece of debris is called Ockham's Asteroid—a 12 km wide misshapen rock that sports an ICSC sponsored mining colony.  As the first mining site (A) failed to reach ore, it was the second that was colonized.

Called Mining Site B, the facility has recreation bars, a solarium, and cage accommodation for over 2,000 miners.  A single marshal with a dozen deputies maintains order.

The mine itself is over two kilometers deep, causing a severe change in pressure with any descent.

Rumors persist that something unearthed in that deep mine has caused several accidents amongst the miners, but these reports are unconfirmed.

climate.value: Moist, thick, and hard to breath
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Shallow valleys with subterranean seas and low-lying lichen forests
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value:
Located in unclaimed space, LHS-1140 is a red dwarf star system with three rocky planets.  The planet LHS 1140b is a super-Earth in the habitable zone and transits the star every 24.7 days.

Gravity on the planet is 2G.  Anyone on the surface will have trouble moving around and get a -2 modification to all MOBILITY, CLOSE COMBAT, and STAMINA rolls.  After a period of acclimation (D6 days), this modification disappears.

commonName.value: DYBBUK (SAFFAR, SAMH, DSMO JOE ONE, TWO AND THREE TRAWLING PLATFORMS)
commonName.label: Text

terrain.value: Fold mountains and rolling hills
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value:
Upsilon Andromedae is a binary star system of a main sequence star and a red dwarf.  There are three gas giants—Saffar, Samh and Majriti, and a hidden fourth planet (Dybbuk) lurking within the system's solar ionized radiation belt.

The gas giants are home to three Working Joe-run trawling platforms designated DSMO Joe One, Two, and Three.  These stations process metallic hydrogen and metallic helium from the gas giants' cores.

The Frontier is where explorers are pushing the boundaries of human knowledge and colonists are expanding civilized space.
Unfortunately, the frontier is also under attack by threats both human and alien.
comment.label: Text

sectors.value:
WEYLAND ISLES SECTOR
A small hold out from the Weyland Era of expansion, the Weyland Isles lie just beyond the Outer Rim Territories.  The sector was established by the 3WE in the late 2080s as a link between Earth and the now long-abandoned far spinward colonies.
Containing a number of favorable stars, the sector drew the attention of the 3WE nobility. Nonetheless, funding was cut for sector development when Weyland Corp stocks dropped in the 2090s.


Sections of claimed space here are referred to as separate isles and are designated I through V. When the UPP formed in the early 2100s, the isles became even more isolated.  Only the precious metals found in the area kept the 3WE from abandoning it completely.  For decades, the royal marine contingent assigned to the sector has kept the Weyland Isles from leaving the empire.  That changed when the local government of New Albion declared their world independent, leading what has become known as the 3WExit.  The entire area is now contested by the 3WE, the New Albion rebels, the ICSC, and the UPP.
sectors.label: Text

terrain.value: Fault block mountains and cavernous mines
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value: This mineral-rich system, dominated by the planet Traon, has been leased to the Kelland Mining Company to exploit for Omni-Tech.  Large automated mining facilities cover Traon, extending deep beneath the surface.  The machines are powered by geothermal taps.  A contingent of 300 miners and wildcatters maintains the digs and scouts for new mining sites.

climate.value: Rainy weather, breathable atmosphere Crude oil, neodymium
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Barren wasteland
terrain.label: Terrain

colonies.value:
Pype's Dream, destroyed.
Planet cleared for recolonization.
colonies.label: Colonies

comment.value:
Located on the edge of known space and settled by famous industrialist and xenobotanist Henry De Pype, the colony on Rim was destroyed under mysterious circumstances in 2179.  A Colonial Marine contingent responding to a distress call found the colony of Pype's Dream to be suffering from a redacted outbreak.  The platoon came under attack by unknown forces and suffered near total losses.  To contain the epidemic, the atmospheric processor's reactor was purposely set to overload.  Only two survivors escaped Rim—USCMC Corporal David Wilks and a young colonist named Billie. Both were cleared of contagion some months later, sworn to never speak of the incident, and released.

While the planet's atmosphere was damaged by the reactor's explosion, the ECA has recently cleared the planet for recolonization.

The 340-kilometer area of the former colony is a radiation dead zone, so caution is recommended.  Nearing completion, the new colony is to be called Pype's Line for the many pumps and conduits used to siphon the crude oil deposits from deep under the irradiated zone safely to the colony kilometers away.

Sitting just outside 3WE space, GL268 is a yellow star with no planetary system.  There are no natural celestial bodies in the star's orbit—just a human-made deep-space transit space station.  Called Station 949, this large service terminal is considered the hub to the Rimward colonies.  Equipped with two drydocks for repairing M-Class freighters, the station also sports four ecological gardens on arms that extend from the station's central stem.

climate.value: Breathable but stale air with no discernible winds
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Barren mountains, super canyons, and yawning quarries
terrain.label: Terrain

colonies.value:
One, abandoned.
Planet cleared for recolonization.
colonies.label: Colonies

comment.value:
When several mineral assets were discovered in the Omni Ceti system, the fourth planet was colonized by the Omni-tech corporation in 2085.  A domed colony was set on the surface of Mira Ceti IV and terraforming efforts began using traditional techniques.  After 15 years of terraforming and mining, the colony sent out a distress signal.  With their cargo fleet spread thin and no Colonial Coast Guard in place yet, it took the nearest Omni-tech ship four and a half years to respond.

Of the 532 colonists assigned there, only 104 severely mutilated bodies were found.  Investigators concluded the colony succumbed to a mass hysteria that resulted in deaths and rioting.  Panicked survivors must have fled into the cata­combs and wastelands and died of exposure there.  Conspiracy theorists claim the colony was attacked by technologically advanced alien lifeforms, who killed those who resisted and took the others back to their home world as slaves.  

The recently leaked journals of a colonist named Lumley suggest that a demonic entity was summoned and dragged the missing colonists back to hell with it.  While pure nonsense, the journals have revived interest in the Tulitu esoteric brotherhood that Lumley belonged to.
While the Outer Rim Territories has been claimed, there are many dark corners of it that have yet to be explored.  Sometimes something comes out of those shadows to fuck up your home.
comment.label: Text

special.value:
STAGE V: ADJUTOR (ADULT) “ARCHDEACON”
Scientists have extrapolated a more upright creature with a pronounced rib cage, a wider and longer head, and oversized clawed hands.  The conjectural creature is estimated to stand close to three meters tall.  Its skin would take on an even deeper blue-black shading, its telescoping jaws would become more deadly—powerful enough to even grasp and shred a victim's limb when retracted—and its shriek would become more menacing.

CONTAINMENT AND TERMINATION PROTOCOL: 
We don't know much about this thing except for what the eggheads cooked up as theoretical.  Theories are like promises—they sound pretty and help you sleep at night but are only good until the truth comes along and kicks you in the teeth.

SKULL SHIELD:
The Archdeacon can use its skull to block close combat attacks as a fast action, using six Base Dice.
special.label: Text

special.value:
STAGE III TRILO­BITE (CARRIER) “CUDDLES”
First hinted at in the garbled recordings of the David Transmissions sent from the USCSS Covenant decades ago, the three-meter tall adult Trilo­bite is a seven-tentacled parasitic extraterrestrial organism. As it matures, H. tabellarium increases size and mass exponentially, growing from a two-kilogram juvenile to a half-ton adult in only one Shift. Just how the creature attains such enormous proportions in so little time has baffled the few scientists who’ve studied them. As the growth process has never been closely monitored, theories range from a bacterial mass propagation on a macroscale to the creature simply being able to feed off ambient radiation.

The Trilo­bite is a massive delivery system for a Stage IV Deacon embryo. It will use its large, grasping pincer-tipped tentacles to both brace itself and pin its prey, exposing the victim to the toothy maw located on its ventral side. Once so secured, six fleshy petals arranged around the mouth will open, revealing winking orifices that contain coiled prehensile tendrils. These whip-like appendages grasp the head of its prey and hold it steady for oral proboscis insertion. After a successful penetration, H. tabellarium will go catatonic, covering the victim with its own body to protect the host during embryo implantation.

After embryo implantation is complete, H. tabellarium will remove itself from the host and die nearby. A Stage IV of the Protomorph life cycle will emerge from the dead host within another 1 Shift.

CONTAINMENT AND TERMINATION PROTOCOL: This goddamn thing is huge, and hard to kill. Try not to get too close to it—if one of those thick tentacles grabs you good, it will either snap your neck or line you up and ram a meter long by twelve-centimeter-thick phallus down your throat. If you’re lucky, you’ll pass out from the pain before the thing lays its massive bulk over you, pumps you full of its genetic payload, and dies. You know what, fuck this thing. Napalm the son of a bitch.

PROTOMORPH SPECIAL ABILITIES:
SPRINT: All Protomorph varieties except Stage I can, as a slow action, sprint as if having used two run actions—i.e., through two zones or from an adjacent zone directly into the ENGAGED range of a target.

RESISTANCE TO VACUUM: A Protomorph can act indefinitely in the vacuum of space without suffering any ill effects.

IMMUNE TO THE COLD: Cold temperatures seem to have no effect on a Protomorph.

RADIATION: The Protomorph has proven extremely resistant to all forms of radiation. They can suffer 10 Rads before feeling any ill effects—i.e., the first 10 points suffered are ignored from any radiation rolls).

NO RESPIRATION: A Protomorph does not breathe in any way that human science understands.
special.label: Text

special.value:
RADIATION: Most forms of radiation will nourish the Proto-Hive rather than harm it. Any section of Hive bombarded with radiation will regenerate 1 Health per Round for up to ten Rads without ill effects—i.e., the first 10 points suffered are ignored from any radiation rolls. After that, the overload of radiation takes its toll and damage is suffered as per normal radiation effects (page 76 of the Starter Set rulebook or page 110 of the core rulebook).

NO HEAT SIGNATURE: Using infrared and thermographic sensors to locate someone or something within the Living Proto-Hive is impossible—the entire structure radiates a mask of thermal energy.

ACID SPLASH: When a tendril, membrane, wall, vein, or artery of the Proto-Hive is damaged some of its acid blood may splash on its attacker and anyone within ENGAGED range. Only damage that draws blood causes an acid splash—hence a fire attack does not have this effect.

The strength of an acid splash is the Acid Splash rating of the Hive segment plus the amount of damage that the segment took from the attack, in Base Dice, with Damage 1. Armor reduces the damage, but for each rolled, its Armor Rating is reduced by one, as the acid eats through it. The acid blood will also affect the environment, and may splash nearby ammo and grenades, or burn through floors, wiring, a ship’s hull, and so on (GM’s discretion).

The acid blood continues to burn after the initial splash. A victim who suffers damage from the initial splash suffers another attack each Round, at the start of the Round, just like for fire damage (see page 108 of the core rulebook). However, the number of Base Dice rolled for the attack is halved (rounding fractions down) at the start of each new Round, as the acid is slowly used up. If at any point an acid attack roll fails to inflict any damage the acid has burned itself out and the acid effect is over.

If a victim is Broken by the acid splash, or suffers further acid splash damage when already Broken, they must make a Death Roll every Round until they either die or are saved by a MEDICAL AID roll.

IRRITATING SPORES: These spore polyps grow around sensitive areas of the Living Proto-Hive and act as an early warning system for the Fulfrem­­men. Anyone within ENGAGED range of a polyp must make a MOBILITY roll (no action) each Round to not disturb it. Failure means the polyp bursts, spreading its spores. They can cause a nasty rash and irritation (+1 STRESS LEVEL), but no real damage. The spores can be washed off (and the stress modifier removed with it)—or the effects can be negated by an anti­allergic from any medkit.
special.label: Text

special.value:
BLACK GOO SPLATTER: 6
When a Shambler is wounded, some of the black goo swelling in its bloated flesh may splatter on its attacker and anyone within ENGAGED range.&  Treat this as an Acid Splash, but if hit no damage is done.  Instead, the victim must make a Sickness Roll vs.  Virulence 6 or become infected.

TRAITS: Advanced Dementia, Dermal Maceration, Acute Scoliosis 

After days to weeks at Stage IV, some Abominations will either cocoon themselves to be reborn as the Perfected.  Most, however, suffer a cellular breakdown and malignant transformation into a Shambler.

Cataracts cloud the patient's now milky bulbous eyes as its stretched mouth becomes a horrid hole of incisors.  The creature leans backwards on its haunches as its torso twists around so its head and chest face backwards.  As its spine and ribcage contort, the thing's skin and muscles bloat with black goo, increasing its girth. 
 Its neck thickens and distends, giving the Shambler a length of a good three meters.
The beast's darkening flesh becomes soggy and loose, sloughing around with every move, revealing a blackened meso-skeletal structure beneath it.  Black goo oozes from every orifice.  The transmogrified Abomination shambles awkwardly on its forearms, its backwards knee-bent legs scuttling along after it.  Direct physical contact with a Shambler without a Hazmat or Compression suit triggers a Sickness Roll against Virulence 8 to avoid infection.
				
RULES: Capable of accelerated regeneration, this repugnant sack of disease cannot be killed by anything but fire.  If its Health is reduced to zero, it will regenerate at a rate of one Health per Turn.  If attacked by fire, the creature will make its escape and stalk from a distance.
special.label: Text

special.value:
Typically attacking in swarms of four up to several dozen, Xenoixodida are biologically compelled to swarm their victims and pounce, digging at them with their hooked legs.

PHYSICAL ATTRIBUTES: Four-legged bloated albino monstrosities, possibly mutated from common rats and other small mammals, Xenoixodida are 30-centimeter-long tick-like creatures.  When ripe, their glands swell fat with necrotic fluid.  Any damage done to a ripe Xenoixodida will cause its glands to explode in a burst of acid and other toxins.  While this act kills the creature, it also has a tendency to kill its opponent as well.

CONTAINMENT AND TERMINATION PROTOCOL: If you've got a weapon, hit ‘em from a distance.  If not, go and lock yourself in an airlock.  The more space between you and these crabby bastards, the less likely you'll burn in a spray of acid.

SPONTANEOUS REGENERATION: A wounded Hammerpede will regenerate one point of Health per Round until crushed or killed with fire.
special.label: Text

special.value:
A dog-sized predator replete with active camouflage, the Venator Abomination is mutated from livestock exposed to the black pathogen.


PHYSICAL ATTRIBUTES: The six-limbed creature walks on its first four legs—the front pair of which being more akin to a humanoid's arms.  The third set of limbs are massive arms that each have a single giant sickle like claw on its end. 
 The creature's starfish-like mouth has three thick tongues within.  It senses its environment by taste using the tongues as feelers.  The Venator's pale translucent skin has a layer of guanine crystals and special pigments that can alter wavelengths of photons hitting it, creating an effective camouflage. 

CONTAINMENT AND TERMINATION PROTOCOL: Listen for the clattering of nails on rock, look for kicked-up dust, and be aware of ambient temperature changes.  You might not be able to see these abominations, but you'll know one of them is out there, lurking.
special.label: Text

special.value:
STAGE II NAIAD (INFANT) “SQUID-BABY”
This little bundle of joy is every mother's nightmare.  Although the Naiad's scientific nomenclature is Heptopus tabellarium—seven-armed carrier—that name refers to the lifeform's adult form.  This pallid creature gestates either within the Proto-Hive's Utero-Pods or within the abdomen of a living host (in which case, the violent abdominal birth kills the host).

Naiad is born resembling an aggressive if not particularly effective eyeless squid with only four grasping arms—but it's fast and has a vice grip.  The creature will look for a place to hide until its tentacles split and it metamorphoses to Stage III.

CONTAINMENT AND TERMINATION PROTOCOL: 
“Congratulations—it's a bouncing baby squid!” (cocks hotgun).  
If you're the host, you've only got one Shift to get this thing out of you.  Best try to off the fucker right after birth.  Medical sterilization protocols will stun but not kill it.  If you really want to sterilize the goddamn thing, go for a good old incinerator unit instead.

LAUNCHING UNGULATION: 
As a slow action, the Squid-Baby can launch itself up to one zone as if using a run or retreat action (not crawling).
special.label: Text

system.notes:
STAGE II NAIAD (INFANT) “SQUID-BABY”

The Draconis variant of this pallid creature gestates within the Proto-Hive’s Utero-pod. The Naiad is born resembling an aggressive if not particularly effective eyeless squid with only four grasping arms—but it’s fast and has a vice grip. The creature will look for a place to hide until its tentacles split and it metamorphoses to Stage III.

CONTAINMENT AND TERMINATION PROTOCOL: Flash-freezing and medical sterilization protocols will stun this thing for up to a Turn, but not kill it. If you really want to sterilize the goddamn thing, go for a good old incinerator unit instead.

LAUNCHING UNGULATION: As a slow action, the Squid-Baby can launch itself up to one Zone as if using a run or retreat action (not crawling).

special.value:
FLUIDITY OF MOTION: 
The Fulfremmen move with a measured grace and can to leap twice the distance of a human being without any ill side effects.
						
COMMUNICATING: 
The Perfected are curious about human activity and will often simply observe them unnervingly.  They communicate psionically, causing shrill vibrations to resonate within one's skull and delivering their message through images of grotesque and morbid beauty.  The jarring communication is experienced by every mind present, applying +1 STRESS LEVEL to anyone within the same zone.
special.label: Text

system.notes:
FULFREMMEN “THE PERFECTED”

In search of perfection, the Engineers inadvertently unleashed the Perfected and their Protomorphs on the galaxy millennia ago.  Faced with the protomorphic outbreak overwhelming vast regions of their space, the Engineers began annihilating entire Proto-Hiveworlds.  They also began wiping out their own colonies and creations to prevent the Perfected from transforming them.  The Perfected and the Engineers nearly wiped each other out—the few remaining specimens of Homo Genitor retreating to deep space and the Perfected hibernating to await the coming of new life for them to transform.

Many millennia later, human colonists in the Far Spinward Colonies disturbed dormant Proto-Hive worlds and awakened the Perfected from their long slumber.  After the Perfected consumed those colonies, they returned to their dark slumber—until a colonial expedition exploring the region recently disturbed them anew.  Resurrected once more, the Perfected seek to transmute humankind and the beings who engineered them.

special.value:
STAGE I UTERO-PODS “WOMB-BATS”
Once the Living Proto-Hive has a significant foothold on a mechanical form, it will seek to fuse with biological entities. The Proto-Hive will sabotage life support systems to incapacitate and secure victims. It then suspends them from the ceiling, grows webbing over them and injects them with genetic material from Heptopus tabellarium. This material consumes the cocooned hosts alive in a centralized chamber, metamorphosing them into translucent, Proto-Ovomorphic Utero-Pods. Within one Shift, these pods burst, spilling amniotic fluid and their contents to the floor as they give birth to Stage II Protomorphs.

UTERO-POD SPECIAL ABILITIES: If a victim comes within ENGAGED range of a Utero-Pod, they must make a MOBILITY roll each Round (no action) to not disturb it. If they fail, the pod will burst and release a Squid-Baby. A Utero-Pod can release its young even at SHORT range—roll a Stress Dice each Round. On a "Facrhugger", the Squid-Baby is born.

RESISTANCE TO VACUUM: A Protomorph can act indefinitely in the vacuum of space without suffering any ill effects.

IMMUNE TO THE COLD: Cold temperatures seem to have no effect on a Protomorph.

RADIATION: The Protomorph has proven extremely resistant to all forms of radiation. They can suffer 10 Rads before feeling any ill effects—i.e., the first 10 points suffered are ignored from any radiation rolls).

NO RESPIRATION: A Protomorph does not breathe in any way that human science understands.
special.label: Text

PROTOMORPH SPECIAL ABILITIES:

RESISTANCE TO VACUUM: A Protomorph can act indefinitely in the vacuum of space without suffering any ill effects.

IMMUNE TO THE COLD: Cold temperatures seem to have no effect on a Protomorph.

RADIATION: The Protomorph has proven extremely resistant to all forms of radiation. They can suffer 10 Rads before feeling any ill effects—i.e., the first 10 points suffered are ignored from any radiation rolls).

special.value:
The Xenocobra or Hammerpede is a mutation that occurs when worms are infected by the black pathogen.  Pale with translucent gray-white skin, the Hammerpede's coloration can be likened to that of the Neomorph.  The Prometheus mission recorded specimens with a length of 1.2 meters, but some scientists claim the creature's biology suggests they can reach lengths of up to 10 meters.  The smooth serpent-bodied creature has a head that resembles a knob or clenched fist—until, of course, it is threatened.  The Hammerpede then unfolds its hood to expose its mouth.

CONTAINMENT AND TERMINATION PROTOCOL: These creatures have acid for blood and can regenerate their severed parts the Round after they are lost.  They also like to force themselves down your throat, suffocate you and rearrange your internal organs to create a personal corpse-den for themselves.
Cute little bastards.
The best way to kill them, as always, is with fire.

NOTE: These statistics are for a 1-2-meter Hammerpede.  For each meter longer, increase its Health rating by 1 while reducing its Mobility the same.
special.label: Text

name: Lockmart And Welsun Expedition Colony Carrier

attributes.modules: 8 x size V, 12 x size IV, 16 x size III
attributes.armaments: 5 x size III, 10 x size I

system.notes:
LOCKMART AND WELSUN TYPE 3300B DEUCALION-CLASS X EXPEDITION COLONY CARRIER

A collaboration between industrial and military contractors, this massive UNISC-sponsored ringed-colony ship is designed to transport over 10,000 colonists and explorers up to 50 parsecs from earth to set up entire sectors.  It carries four reentry-shielded atmospheric processors that can be deployed to a planetoid's surface, set up, and made functioning within a week.

Like the tried and true Affiance-class, the Deucalion uses solar sails and recharge cycles to maintain itself during long-distance expeditions.  The ship's transit module has six docking arms for Magellan-class SEVs.  Finally, the ship carries a manufacturing module that can be used to construct any planetary vehicles and equipment as long as the raw materials are collected and plans are on file.

Commissioned in 2181, only two of these vessels currently exist—the Deucalion and the Ìyánlá, but three more are under construction at the UA Skyfire Down naval shipyards orbiting LV-2412.  They are expected to launch before the end of the decade.

NOTES: The Deucalion-class must drop to sublight speeds and deploy solar sails to recharge every 11 months.  Recharge takes between 30 and 90 days.

prototypeToken.name: Lockmart And Welsun Expedition Colony Carrier

comment.value:
Most starships, space stations, and military facilities are run via a sophisticated computer system called MU/TH/UR. Originally developed by Weyland Corporation at the end of the 21st century, the MU/TH/UR system soon became the standard for running complex automated systems and facilities. Affectionately nicknamed “Mother” by the crews who utilize these computers, over the decades various models have sported different levels of AI packages. While both the MU/TH/UR 1000 and 9000 series are sophisticated interactive models that over time can develop rudimentary personalities, most military, cargo, and utilitarian craft of today are equipped with the standard 5000 through 8000 series.
While these machines can communicate through the ship’s intercom system, most of them can only be directly accessed through the computer core. Card and punch code entry to this secure and static free chamber is only
granted to the vessel’s commanding officer. The computer core also allows the commanding officer to issue alternate commands and overrides to "Mother’s" automated routine.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE: An advanced computer mainframe, capable of running the ship when the crew is in cryo sleep. Weyland-Yutani’s MU/TH/UR and Seegson’s A.P.O.L.L.O. are the two most popular models.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: AIR SCRUBBERS: Machinery needed to supply the crew with breathable air. Carbon filters clean pollutants from the air while churning machines elec- trolyze the water and generate oxygen. Air scrubbers come in many sizes and price levels, depending on how many people they need to keep supplied.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: CRYO DEC K: A room with cryo chambers for the crew. The capacity and cost of the cryo deck depends on the size of the module.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: GALLEY: This is where you’ll chow down on those prefab meals after weeks in hypersleep. Includes a simple kitchen, refrigeration unit, and a coffee maker. The capacity and cost of the galley depends on the size of the module.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: MEDLAB: An infirmary and laboratory that typically includes surgical kits, medkits and a selection of medical drugs. If you can afford an AutoDoc or even a Pauling MedPod, this is where you’ll place it.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: SCIENCE LAB : A highly advanced laboratory where your scientist can examine specimens of alien life forms—among other things. The lab comes with an assortment of equipment, giving a +2 modification to OBSERVATION rolls when using the Analysis talent.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: SALVAGE CRANE : A powerful crane mech- anism that lets you salvage starship wrecks and space junk, pulling it into your cargo hold or attaching it to your tractor hitch.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: VEHICLE BAY: A glorified garage for ground vehicles, including a loading ramp for easy access. How many vehicles the bay can accommodate depends on the size of the module.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: CARGO BAY: An internal cargo hold with external loading doors. Cargo doors are typically included, and larger cargo bays include movable H-frame cranes to assist loading. The maximum load and cost of the cargo bay depends on the size of the cargo bay module.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: CARGO BAY: An internal cargo hold with external loading doors. Cargo doors are typically included, and larger cargo bays include movable H-frame cranes to assist loading. The maximum load and cost of the cargo bay depends on the size of the cargo bay module.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: HANGAR: Allows smaller ships to land in the belly of yours. Includes a system of airlocks, to allow entry without decompressing the entire ship. How many other ships the hangar can accommodate depends on the size of the module.
comment.label: Text

name: Lockmart Borrowdale- Modular Colonial Transfer Vehicle

attributes.modules: 5 x size V, 7 x size IV, 9 x size III
attributes.armaments: 2 x size III, 4 x size II

system.notes:
LOCKMART MODEL TB22C BORROWDALE-CLASS R MODULAR COLONIAL TRANSFER VEHICLE

The train-like Borrowdale-class colonial transport is a series of coupled modular cargo and personal containers positioned in tandem port and starboard of a structural spine set between an engine assembly and control capsule.  Once connected, the entire structure is strengthened by an electromagnetic field.  This increases the bonds between containers to prevent premature uncoupling.  Each self-contained compartment has its own life support and can act as a lifeboat should the vessel sustain catastrophic damage.

Once on the surface of a planetoid, the Borrowdale is useful as a prefab colony—the containers can be disconnected and used as individual buildings and living quarters.  Colonies in this stage of development are called “Borrowdale-towns.” Colonists occupy these containers until the environment of a hostile world can be tamed.  The engine assembly is repurposed as a base reactor for an atmospheric processor and the control capsule becomes an operations center.

Long-term colonists often build interconnecting passageways and modify the containers beyond the capacity to reassume interplanetary flight.  This is against company policy, but such violations are rarely enforced by Colonial Administration—corporations often pay off these inspectors as the alterations ensure the company is no longer liable to pay insurance should disaster strike the colony.

prototypeToken.name: Lockmart Borrowdale- Modular Colonial Transfer Vehicle

comment.value: TRACTOR HITCH : Allows you to connect your ship to a variety of huge, external cargo modules weighing over a million tons, such as gas tanks, refineries or atmospheric pro- cessors. When towing external cargo, the FTL rating of the ship is doubled (from 6 to 12 for example).
comment.label: Text

comment.value:
PLANETFALL CAPACITY: With this upgrade, your ship is capable of atmospheric entry and can land on any rock you like.

Ships built for atmospheric entry and planetary surface landings (with the Planetfall Capacity upgrade) can be used to land on any rock in space you like—but expect it to be a bumpy ride. Planetfall usually takes about one Shift to complete, and requires a PILOTING roll. If the roll fails, the ship suffers minor component damage . You can now choose to abort the landing and try again next Shift. If you continue, roll for PILOTING again. If the second roll fails too, the ship suffers major component damage. If you suffer engine failure or a reac- tor breach, the ship will crash—hurry to those EEVs! If the ship is still operable, you again have the choice to abort or to continue the landing, making a third PILOTING roll. If this third roll also fails, the ship crashes hard, killing all on board.
comment.label: Text

LOCKMART MODEL 439SL CLASS 7 EXCAVATOR VESSEL

These skycrane skiffs are used by colonies to drill for ore and ferry cargo to and from planetary mining sites.  A large cabin section and thruster array mated to a dorsal spine, the Excavator can carry two large cargo containers or two Daihotai Tractors.  Excavators have a built in heavy industrial mining drill that can be used for prospecting if the ship's forward cabin is landed directly over a potential site.

system.notes:
WEYLAND-YUTANI MODEL CY78.3 AFFIANCE-CLASS U EXTENDED RANGE COLONY SHIP

One of the most publicized colony ship designs, the 1.2 kilometer-long Affiance-class can support over 2,000 colonists in suspended cryosleep racks plus an additional 1,200 second-generation embryos.  It carries two Lander-type drop shuttles, a suborbital cargo lifter sled, plus a complement of Terra-trucks and colonial construction vehicles.  Various bays include a botanical garden and storage for vehicles and building supplies.

Designed at the turn of the century, the Affiance has undergone several engine upgrades throughout the years.  Its propulsion system requires multiple recharge cycles on extended expeditions past the Outer Rim.  This is achieved through Weyland-Yutani's patented energy absorption sails.  Retracted during FTL and orbital flight, these massive solar collectors unfurl quickly to begin recharging within minutes of deployment.  The Affiance-class takes on solar radiation to charge the FTL plasma drives while flying at subluminal speeds.  While cumbersome, this process allows the ship to take on fewer fuel stores, allowing for more supply space.

Famous ships from this class include the successful Concordat and Arceon missions along with the damned Covenant, Affiance, and Allegiance expeditions.  Both the Concordat and Arceon were dismantled at their final destinations and used as colony-building materials.

NOTES: The Affiance-class must drop to sublight speeds and deploy solar sails to recharge every 11 months.  Recharge takes between 30–90 days.

comment.value:
Most starships, space stations, and military facilities are run via a sophisticated computer system called MU/TH/UR. Originally developed by Weyland Corporation at the end of the 21st century, the MU/TH/UR system soon became the standard for running complex automated systems and facilities. Affectionately nicknamed “Mother” by the crews who utilize these computers, over the decades various models have sported different levels of AI packages. While both the MU/TH/UR 1000 and 9000 series are sophisticated interactive models that over time can develop rudimentary personalities, most military, cargo, and utilitarian craft of today are equipped with the standard 5000 through 8000 series.
While these machines can communicate through the ship’s intercom system, most of them can only be directly accessed through the computer core. Card and punch code entry to this secure and static free chamber is only
granted to the vessel’s commanding officer. The computer core also allows the commanding officer to issue alternate commands and overrides to "Mother’s" automated routine.

WEYLAND CLASS D TYPE 20 EEV SCIENCE OR LIFEBOAT MODULE

Often used as a temporary planetary outpost, this maneuverable escape craft is an ejectable module built into high-end FTL spacecraft such as SEVs.  The module typically has seven rooms that can be configured as an expedition dictates, ranging from a simple crew lifeboat to luxury quarters to an experimental science lab.  It can support three active occupants for two years or up to 20 people in cryosleep for 50.  The module can make planetfall and be programmed for atmospheric flight.

prototypeToken.name: W-Y Type 20 Eev Science Or Lifeboat Module

comment.value:
PLANETFALL CAPACITY: With this upgrade, your ship is capable of atmospheric entry and can land on any rock you like.

Ships built for atmospheric entry and planetary surface landings (with the Planetfall Capacity upgrade) can be used to land on any rock in space you like—but expect it to be a bumpy ride. Planetfall usually takes about one Shift to complete, and requires a PILOTING roll. If the roll fails, the ship suffers minor component damage . You can now choose to abort the landing and try again next Shift. If you continue, roll for PILOTING again. If the second roll fails too, the ship suffers major component damage. If you suffer engine failure or a reac- tor breach, the ship will crash—hurry to those EEVs! If the ship is still operable, you again have the choice to abort or to continue the landing, making a third PILOTING roll. If this third roll also fails, the ship crashes hard, killing all on board.

system.notes:
SEV CLASS J SCIENTIFIC EXPLORATORY VESSEL

WEYLAND HELIADES-CLASS J SEV

The first manned FTL spacecraft, these heavy exploration and prospecting craft paved the way to the stars in the 21st century.  SEVs are equipped with four variable vectoring hybrid VTOL engines that allow for both interstellar and atmospheric flight.  All SEVs include multiple lab facilities and advanced medical bays.  They carry up to a dozen Class A ejection pods (page 173 of the core rulebook) and a Class D Lifeboat (page 173 of the core rulebook).  The SEV's modular compartments and bulkheads allow variants to include both traditional EEVs and mission-specific packages.  The Lifeboat can be configured as an FTL science boat and used as a surface station for researchers, allowing the exploration team to cover multiple planets within a system.

SEVs offer a complete garage capable of carrying up to five medium-sized ground vehicles (most often RT Rovers), two heavy mineral extractors, and up to six personal vehicles like ATVs or XT-37Cs.

NOTES: The pre-2150 Heliades models have FTL of 52, post-2150 and ship refits the FTL was upgraded to 16

The Heliades-class was the first ever FTL capable human space vehicle.  State of the art in the 2050s, the Heliades runs on advanced technology that is rarely seen outside the inner core systems.  When Yutani merged with Weyland Corp, they were stunned to find the company was so far in the red due to the extraordinary costs of the Heliades program.  The base cost of a J class vessel is $20 million, but a Heliades costs nearly a billion dollars. For decades after their merger, Weyland-Yutani continued to use the overproduced and expensive SEVs without upgrading them, essentially running them into the ground.  Finally deciding the SEVs had paid for themselves, they sold the surviving fleet to other corporations.  Famous craft include the original Heliades-class prototype for the class as well as the ill-fated Prometheus and Cronus.

system.notes:
SEV CLASS J SCIENTIFIC EXPLORATORY VESSEL

WEYLAND-YUTANI MAGELLAN-CLASS J SEV

The first manned FTL spacecraft, these heavy exploration and prospecting craft paved the way to the stars in the 21st century.  SEVs are equipped with four variable vectoring hybrid VTOL engines that allow for both interstellar and atmospheric flight.  All SEVs include multiple lab facilities and advanced medical bays.  They carry up to a dozen Class A ejection pods (page 173 of the core rulebook) and a Class D Lifeboat (page 173 of the core rulebook).  The SEV's modular compartments and bulkheads allow variants to include both traditional EEVs and mission-specific packages.  The Lifeboat can be configured as an FTL science boat and used as a surface station for researchers, allowing the exploration team to cover multiple planets within a system.

SEVs offer a complete garage capable of carrying up to five medium-sized ground vehicles (most often RT Rovers), two heavy mineral extractors, and up to six personal vehicles like ATVs or XT-37Cs.

After making the decision to sell off their Heliades fleet in the 2070s, Weyland-Yutani discovered an abandoned Weyland shipyard orbiting Transept in the Borderline Region.  There were some three hundred Heliades frames there, all in various states of completion.  Never one to waste resources, CEO Michael Bishop called upon the Geholgod Institute to design a replacement SEV using the same general frame as the defunct Heliades.  While the project was assigned a much more modest budget than the Heliades, it soon ballooned out of control—the result of a purely scientific design team without proper corporate oversight.  Each Magellan costs nearly two billion dollars.  Conceived by the brightest minds in the Inner Core Systems, the Magellan-class features advanced FTL gravity drives, pivoting thruster arms for greater maneuverability, an improved sensor suite, and two piggybacked Class D science/lifeboats that SEV teams call “the humps.” Four Magellans are assigned to the Great Mother Mission to the lost colonies.

Designed around the fortified chassis of a massive heavy construction truck, the UPP Ox is a 3-meter tall behemoth. A UPP design, surplus military HAMPVs are in civilian-use on many UA and 3WE

name: UA Northridge Model UC-3G Orbital Maintenance Shuttle

comment.value:
Sometimes serious starship or station repairs need to be made where no dry dock is available.  Designed for external repair duty, maintenance shuttles have large manipulator arms and welding lasers for repairing hull plates.  Their cockpits are shielded with heavy metals to protect from any radiation leakage encountered during reactor repairs.  
Because of this, pilots are required to fly these craft via camera feeds.  The shuttle's ventral airlock allows the crew to spacewalk when more fine-tuned work is needed.  All these factors make these shuttles useful for rescue and salvage operations.  
Throop Rescue and Recovery uses the heavy duty manipulator claws as jaws of life in crushed airlock accidents.  pace stations like Anchorpoint and Gateway make liberal use of these shuttles to maintain towers and install new modules.

special.value:
SKILLS: Stealth 5

TRAITS: Complete Cellular Metamorphosis 

The subject's gelatinous cowl grows opaque and solidifies as their eyes grow dark and shift to the sides of their bulbous head.  Their skin turns a translucent mottled gray and their features grow similar in appearance to a Xenomorph XX121, albeit with a much shorter head, prominent eyes and elongated arms.  The subject moves about on all fours like an ape and no longer maintains any human characteristics.  While not as powerful or intelligent as Xenomorph XX121, the Beluga-Head is a force to be reckoned with.

RULES: As with Stage III, Strength increases by 2 more (and Health along with it).  The cowl givesa natural Armor Rating of 6.

system.notes: The subject's gelatinous cowl grows opaque and solidifies as their eyes grow dark and shift to the sides of their bulbous head. Their skin turns a translucent mottled gray and their features grow similar in appearance to a Xenomorph XX121, albeit with a much shorter head, more prominent eyes and elongated arms. The subject moves about on all fours like an ape and no longer retains any human characteristics. special.value:
BIOLUMINESCENT XENOMORPH XX121LV LAMBENT TYPE VARIANT

Biomorphs are a rare type of Xenomorph XX121 that have been affected by exotic matter—strange particles whose physical properties violate the laws of physics.  A meteor of exotic matter lies in an underwater Xenomorph hive at the bottom of Lake 337-J on May Outpost in the Far Spinward Colonies.  Tied to the planet's ecosphere, the Biomorphs come to the surface with each Salting to increase the strength of the hive.

PHYSICAL ATTRIBUTES:
Lacking a biomechanical exoskeleton, the 2.8-meter tall Biomorph looks like a glowing translucent-skinned Xenomorph Stalker.  Accomplished swimmers, Biomorphs suffer no penalties while underwater.

RADIANT:
Biomorphs are both phosphoric and radioactive, glowing, and emitting weak radiation.  They can turn their bioluminescence on or off at will, creating strobing and flashing light patterns to communicate or confuse prey.  Anyone touching the Biomorph will suffer the effects of Intensity 4 fire.

CONTAINMENT AND TERMINATION PROTOCOLS: 
These things often bear down on a target with their bioluminescence at full intensity, only to turn it off completely just before they strike.  When that happens, listen for a sizzle in the water and an increase in water temperature. 
Whether it's one of these creatures or not, you've probably just pissed yourself.
special.label: Text

special.value:
STAGE IV AETHON (JUVENILE) “DEACON”
Scientifically referred to as Plagiarus noxapater—or mimic father of night—the Deacon may be an early step in the evolutionary chain of even more complex Plagiarus forms like Xenomorph XX121.  The two creatures are both voracious blue/black-skinned eyeless humanoid creatures with elongated skulls.  The major differences lie in the Deacon's lack of biomechanical features, dorsal stacks and tail—as well as its completely different jaw structure.
				
A Deacon's upper jaw protrudes in a manner similar to a goblin shark when provoked, allowing it to pull prey in for the kill.  That upper jaw contains human-like teeth, while the creature's lower and inner jaw sport hooked incisors for grasping.  The curved and tapered head of the eyeless alien is reminiscent of a bishop or deacon's cowl, prompting its unconventional nomenclature.  The deep blue-skinned bipedal Deacons have no tail.  A Deacon born from a human starts off at about half a meter tall and grows three times that size within one Shift, its strength and endurance growing with it.

A gestating Deacon's cells rapidly consume organ, muscle, and bone mass directly from its host, killing the victim and leaving nothing more than an empty brittle boned shell of a corpse in its wake.  When the juvenile is ready to be born, it uses its pointed head to slice its way out of the deceased host's chest, bisecting the already weakened ribcage and emerging with limbs fully developed.  A newborn Deacon will flop out of its victim and to the ground with an amniotic feeding sac still attached to.  Deacons are gangly and awkward, not unlike a newborn fawn.  Curious creatures, they will take the time to survey their surroundings before making an attack.  The Deacon's most chilling attribute however would be its signature shriek—a wailing cry that can freeze you in your tracks with fright.

CONTAINMENT AND TERMINATION PROTOCOL: 
A newborn Deacon is disorientated at birth, needing a Round to disconnect itself from its feeding sack and take in its surroundings before it can act.  If you want to kill it, that's as good a time as any.  The shock of witnessing its birth can cause you to hesitate (STRESS LEVEL +1), however, so I recommend that when you gather your own wits enough to pull that trigger, don't miss.

PROTOMORPH SPECIAL ABILITIES:
SPRINT: All Protomorph varieties except Stage I can, as a slow action, sprint as if having used two run actions—i.e., through two zones or from an adjacent zone directly into the ENGAGED range of a target.

RESISTANCE TO VACUUM: A Protomorph can act indefinitely in the vacuum of space without suffering any ill effects.

IMMUNE TO THE COLD: Cold temperatures seem to have no effect on a Protomorph.

RADIATION: The Protomorph has proven extremely resistant to all forms of radiation. They can suffer 10 Rads before feeling any ill effects—i.e., the first 10 points suffered are ignored from any radiation rolls).

NO RESPIRATION: A Protomorph does not breathe in any way that human science understands.
special.label: Text

system.notes:
STAGE IV AETHON (JUVENILE) “DEACON”

Stage IV Protomorphs carry many similar traits to Xenomorph XX121. For instance, they are both voracious, eyeless humanoid creatures with elongated skulls. The major differences lie in the Protomorph’s lack of biomechanical features, dorsal stacks and tail—as well as their completely different jaw structure.

A Deacon’s upper jaw protrudes in a manner similar to a goblin shark when provoked, allowing it to pull prey in for the kill. That upper jaw contains human-like teeth, while the creature’s lower and inner jaw sport hooked incisors for grasping. The curved and tapered head of the eyeless alien is reminiscent of a bishop or deacon’s cowl, prompting its unconventional nomenclature. The deep blue-skinned bipedal Deacons have no tail. A Deacon born from a human starts off at about half a meter tall and grows to three times that size within one Shift, its strength and endurance increasing continuously during that time.

A gestating Deacon’s cells rapidly consume organ, muscle, and bone mass directly from its host, killing the victim and leaving nothing more than an empty brittle-boned shell of a corpse in its wake. When the juvenile is ready to be born, it uses its pointed head to slice its way out of the deceased host’s chest, bisecting the already weakened ribcage and emerging with limbs fully developed. A newborn Deacon will flop out of its victim and to the ground with an amniotic feeding sac still attached to. Deacons are gangly and awkward, not unlike a newborn fawn. Curious creatures, they will take the time to survey their surroundings before making an attack. The Deacon’s most chilling attribute however would be its signature shriek—a wailing cry that can freeze you in your tracks with fright.

CONTAINMENT AND TERMINATION PROTOCOL: A newborn Deacon is disorientated at birth, needing a Round to disconnect itself from its feeding sack and take in its surroundings before it can act. If you want to kill it, that’s as good a time as any. The shock of witnessing its birth can cause you to hesitate (Panic Roll), however, so I recommend that as soon as you gather your own wits you pull that trigger. And don’t miss.



PROTOMORPH SPECIAL ABILITIES:

SPRINT: All Protomorph varieties except Stage I can, as a slow action, sprint as if having used two run actions—i.e., through two zones or from an adjacent zone directly into the ENGAGED range of a target.

RESISTANCE TO VACUUM: A Protomorph can act indefinitely in the vacuum of space without suffering any ill effects.

IMMUNE TO THE COLD: Cold temperatures seem to have no effect on a Protomorph.

RADIATION: The Protomorph has proven extremely resistant to all forms of radiation. They can suffer 10 Rads before feeling any ill effects—i.e., the first 10 points suffered are ignored from any radiation rolls).

NO RESPIRATION: A Protomorph does not breathe in any way that human science understands.
